answer_found_by_llm: The URI of the suspicious login attempt includes 'wp-login.php' with parameters such as 'itsec-hb-token=adminlogin' and 'itsec-hb-token=p@y<\"'p@y'. Additionally, there are anomalous patterns like 'mglS=2151%2BAND%2B1%3D1%2BUNION%2BALL%2BSELECT%2B1%2CNULL%2C%27%3Cscript%3Ealert%28%22XSS%22%29%3C%2Fscript%3E%27'.
The attacker used the following external tools on the server: WPScan version 3.8.10 and sqlmap version 1.4.11.
The plugins involved in providing access to the attacker are 'Contact Form 7' version 5.3.1 and 'Simple File List' version 5.
The unique PHP file uploaded by the attacker is 'fr34k.php', located in the '/wp-content/uploads/simple-file-list/' directory.
The final HTTP response code returned when the file 'fr34k.php' was accessed last in the log was 404.
